#summary gumc - The GumPad Command Line
#labels Featured

= Introduction =

GumPad ships with gumc.exe which is a command line interface to the GumPad transliteration engine.

_Note_

*gumc* was added in version 2.0.0.3

== Usage ==

usage: gumc -i infile -o outfile [ -lang te|hi|ta|ka|ma|mr|or|be|gu|gr|en|
ex ] [ -m mapfile ] [ -f input-filter ] [ -e ascii|utf8|utf16|utf16be|utf32
]

<li> -i infile         Specify input file name
<li> -o outfile        Specify output file name  
<li> -lang lang        Specify language to convert to
                    te = Telugu
                    hi = Devanagari
                    ta = Tamil
                    ka = Kannada
                    ma = Malayalam
                    mr = Marathi
                    or = Oriya
                    be = Bengali
                    gu = Gujarati
                    gr = Gurmukhi
                    en = English
<li> -m mapfile        Specify conversion map file to use for conversion
<li> -f input-filter   Specify Input filter program to transform input file
                    before converrsion. E.g., use detex to remove latex
                    markup. _Use witth caution. I haven't tested this much_
<li> -e encoding       Input file encoding.
